pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.8: Agāraṁ is typically rendered as “in a house”. The problem with this is that it is not unallowable for a monastic to live in a building that is the equivalent of a house. What a monastic should not do is own a home and then live there.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.10: For an explanation of these renderings, see Family Relationships in the Appendix of Technical Terms.
